definition: to describe sth as/an analogy/a simile/a metaphor/an allegory

sentences.english: There are the metaphor phenomena by diet in Chinese ancient literature and art criticism.
sentences.chinese: 藝術批評中普遍存在着喜好借用飲食譬喻的現象。

sentences.english: This analogy explains where the Buddha-nature comes from.
sentences.chinese: 這個譬喻，是說明佛性從什麼地方來的？

sentences.english: Only in this way can I know whwhenever desire not be nearly give up oned by time.
sentences.chinese: 譬喻愛一小我，想知道安靜一點的歌。

sentences.english: I'm regularly making resolutions- like giving up smoking.
sentences.chinese: 我總在做出確定，譬喻戒菸。

sentences.english: Mental impressions such as these may be regarded as the metaphors of thoughts and notions.
sentences.chinese: 象這樣的表象，一般地講來可看成思想和概念的譬喻。
其實這只是一種譬喻罷了。

sentences.english: The notion of analogy came from music language in the West Zhou Dynasty, referring to comparison by species.
sentences.chinese: 興的概念來自西周的樂語，其本義是連類譬喻。

sentences.english: To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.
sentences.chinese: 使人明白箴言和譬喻，懂得智慧人的言詞和謎語。

definition: to compare/to liken to/metaphor/analogy/figure of speech/figuratively
to use sth as a metaphor
